results.title: Tarzan (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Chris Buck, Kevin Lima, Bonnie Arnold and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Disney brings Edgar Rice Burroughs’ story ‘Tarzan’ to life in this full length animated film. Tarzan is a baby boy, adopted by a gorilla named Kala, following the death of her own child. She brings him into the group against the wishes of their leader, a large silverback gorilla named Kerchak. Tarzan quickly makes friends with a gorilla named Terk, and an elephant named Tantor despite his obvious differences. Tarzan grows up believing he is one of the gorillas - until he meets Jane. This event changes Tarzan’s life as he learns about who and what he really is. Featuring five songs written and performed by Phil Collins including the Oscar winning song “You’ll be in my heart”, and the voices of Glenn Close, Rosie O’Donnell, Minnie Driver, Wayne Knight, Nigel Hawthorne and Alex D. Linz as the voice of young Tarzan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Buck, Kevin Lima, Bonnie Arnold and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: TB trailer
results.brief_description: Points out that TB (tuberculosis) can be eradicated from Australia, if sufferers are found and cured. Urges that everyone, including older people, should have an annual chest X-ray.

results.title: Taxi = Taksi
results.creator_credit: Arifin C Noer, Manu Sukmajaya and Raviman Film
results.brief_description: One of Arifin C. Noer’s well-known works, ‘Taksi’ is a social commentary about going against the establishment. Guyon, a philosophy graduate, decides to leave the comfort of his rich uncle’s house to become a taxi driver after two years of being unemployed. During one of his rounds, Guyon picks up an unwed mother on her way to a singing audition. She entrusts the baby with him and the two develop a friendship; she succeeds in the entertainment business but is drawn into a web of lies and posturing. The film swept all the major awards at the 1990 Citra Awards including Best Actor - Rano Karno. This, his first Citra Award, propelled Karno into mega-stardom in Indonesia. Cast also includes Meriam Bellina. In Indonesian with English subtitles that are sometimes hard to read.

results.title: Taxi!
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In any large city one of the most visible and, at the same time, anonymous characters is the taxi driver. Taxi! takes an absorbing, entertaining and sometimes comical look at a world few of us are familiar with. The filmmaker, a former cabbie, has produced a unique documentary study of the drivers, fleet operators and dispatchers who are expected to deliver passengers, parcels, and even babies. Photographed by day and night, the film explores the realities of the taxi business, the economics, and life as witnessed from behind the steering wheel.

results.title: Tarnished angels [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Albert Zugsmith and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Pylon” by William Faulkner, this powerful drama, set in New Orleans at the Mardi Gras’ aerial circus in 1932, revolves around a disenchanted trio of air circus daredevils. The story is about failure, a glimpse of the twilight world of ‘flying gypsies’ through the eyes of an alcoholic newspaperman. Faulkner’s style is necessarily transmuted not so much by an undeniable gloss and glamour brought to the playing out of tortured relationships, as by an unsurpassed density of visual expression and atmosphere. In linking festivity and death, Sirk finds correlatives for entrapment: circular motion and symbols of circularity, alternating areas of darkness and light, the clutter of objects and the unconventional ordering of shots. Cast includes Rock Hudson, Robert Stack, Dorothy Malone, Jack Carson, Robert Middleton.

results.title: Tax: the outcome of income
results.creator_credit: Veronika Soul, Rupert Glover, Canada. Revenue Canada Customs, Excise and Taxation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This montage of animated photographs and medieval drawings, superimposed on archival and contemporary film footage, traces the evolution of Canada’s system of taxation through the boom times and the bad times of Canadian history. The film examines the persistent struggle for tax revenue waged between federal and provincial governments since Confederation, and concludes with a fast-moving look at Canada’s modernized tax system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Veronika Soul, Rupert Glover, Canada. Revenue Canada Customs, Excise and Taxation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Taxi
results.creator_credit: Roland Stutz, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Claude Leveillee expresses the frustration’s of a taxi driver steering his vehicle through the obstacle course of downtown traffic. Accelerated camera action heightens the fury and the frenzy. Singer - Claude Leveille.

results.title: Tattooed Tears
results.creator_credit: Joan Churchill, Nicholas Broomfield and Gogo Films
results.brief_description: Undaunted, indeed challenged, by the furore over `Juvenile Liason’ Nick Broomfield and Joan Churchill wanted to make another film about young offenders who had been institutionalised for the purposes of rehabilitation and training. Luckily, they found the Director of the California Youth Authority who, disillusioned and on the verge of retiring, was willing to give them carte blanche with the filming.

results.title: Tattoo 67
results.creator_credit: Michel Regnier, Yves Leduc, Clement Perron and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Highlights of the military spectacle that entertained Canadian audiences from coast to coast during Canada’s centennial celebrations, this major tribute of Canada’s armed forces took three years of preparation and involved over a thousand members. The three-hour program comprised parades and pageantry, historic tableaux, massed bands, drills and gymnastic displays. This film shows a little of each of the main events.

results.title: Tannhauser
results.brief_description: Tannhauser, lover of the Goddess Venus, wishes to return to earth where Elisabeth is secretly in love with him. At a singing competition, Tannhauser sings of the properties of earthly love, which he dedicates to Venus, and spiritual love which is reserved for God alone. Forced to take a penitential journey to Rome to atone for this outrage, but the Pope damns him. Seeking a way back to Venus, Tannhauser encounters the funeral procession of Elizabeth,, and dies upon her bier. In his death, Tannhauser receives divine benediction. Singers are Hans Sotin, Richard Versalle and Cheryl Studer.
